content:
I'll definitely explore more features on my Apple Watch, especially the Breathe app and Workout app. I've been using the Activity app to track my daily steps and exercises, but I haven't really explored the other features. I'll check them out and see how I can incorporate them into my daily routine.

As for my sleep, I've noticed that I've been getting around 6-7 hours of sleep per night, which is still a bit short of the recommended 7-8 hours. But I've been trying to establish a consistent sleep schedule and create a relaxing bedtime routine to improve my sleep quality.

By the way, I've also been tracking my menstrual cycle using the Clue app, and I've noticed that my periods have been getting lighter and shorter over the past few months. I'm not sure if it's related to my increased physical activity or other lifestyle changes, but it's been a welcome change.

What do you think about tracking menstrual cycles, and do you
